required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Registry Study on Serumal Biomarkers About Adverse Events in Patients Undergoing Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting.
clinical_study.official_title: A Chinese Registry to Determine the Serumal Biomarkers for Prognosis of Adverse Events in Patients Undergoing Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting.

lead_sponsor.agency: Beijing Institute of Heart, Lung and Blood Vessel Diseases

clinical_study.source: Beijing Institute of Heart, Lung and Blood Vessel Diseases

brief_summary.textblock: This is a national registry study to determine the serumal biomarkers for prognosis of adverse events in patients undergoing coronary artery bypass grafting.

primary_outcome.time_frame: These data is collected during follow-up visit at in-hospital/1 year after discharge

secondary_outcome.time_frame: These data is collected during follow-up visit at in-hospital/1 year after discharge
secondary_outcome.description: A composite of death, myocardial infarction, stroke, heart failure, ventricular arrhythmia

intervention.intervention_name: A type of operation for coranary heart disease patients.
intervention.description: A type of operation for coranary heart disease patients.

biospec_descr.textblock:
If a blood specimen is obtained, it will be separated and stored at -80 â„ƒ as plasma, viable cells, and extracted DNA. If a saliva specimen is obtained, it is stored for DNA.
If a tissue specimen is obtained, it will be cut into small pieces and stored at liquid nitrogen.

study_pop.textblock: Group consists of patients who underwent coronary artery bypass grafting in Beijing Anzhen Hospital.
